p: Patients at any age can contract infection with the SARS-CoV-2 and any system can be involved. Patients can be either asymptomatic carriers or develop symptoms, ranging from the common mild symptoms of upper respiratory tract infection of fever, dry cough, dyspnea, myalgia, and fatigue to the severe respiratory or multi-organ failure. Less common symptoms include anosmia, diarrhea, abdominal pain, dizziness, headache and confusion, and hemoptysis. Although pneumonia is present in most SARS-CoV-2 infected patients, few cases complained of pleuritic chest pain [ 15, 25, 27, 32].
